article.headline: Drake 90, Bradley 67
article.story: DES MOINES, Iowa (AP) -- Joshua Robinson scored 15 points and Josh Powell 14 points as Drake beat Bradley 90-67 Thursday night. The Bulldogs (6-5 overall, 2-1 Missouri Valley Conference), coming off an upset victory over league favorite Wichita State Monday night, made it look easy finishing the game hitting 62 per cent of its shots. David Bancroft scored 11 of his 13 points in the first half including three slam dunks. Mike Suggs led Bradley (8-6, 1-2) with 12 points. Marcus Sommerville and James Gillingham had 10 each for the Braves. It was Drake's highest point total this season and the worst margin of defeat for Bradley. The Braves took their only lead when Chris Mroz hit a 3-pointer with 10:15 left in the first half for a 17-15 Bradley advantage. The Bulldogs responded with a 19-2 run as Nate Richie connected on two 3-pointers. Drake led 46-29 at halftime. The Bulldogs, playing for the first time at home in three weeks, built their lead to 77-57 when Chaun Brooks intercepted a pass and went the length of the court for a slam dunk with 5:29 left.
